◆ error_cb_t

using DeckLink::CaptureCallback::error_cb_t = std::function<void(VideoInputError)>

Type of the error callback function.

This is the type of the callback function that is called when an error occurs giving the user a chance to handle it.

◆ set_bad_frame_threshold()

void DeckLink::CaptureCallback::set_bad_frame_threshold ( int  bad_frame_threshold)

The bad frame threshold is number of consecutive empty frames that should be considered an error.

Dropped frames will happen every now and then and might not always be considered an error but more than 15 consecutive might definitely be.

This gives you some freedom to customize this behaviour.

Definition at line 143 of file capture_callback.cpp.

◆ VideoInputFormatChanged()

HRESULT DeckLink::CaptureCallback::VideoInputFormatChanged ( BMDVideoInputFormatChangedEvents  notification_events_raw,
IDeckLinkDisplayMode *  new_display_mode,
BMDDetectedVideoInputFormatFlags  detected_signal_flags_raw 
)
override

This method is called by the hardware when a video input format change is detected.

The most common case for this is when the stream has been enabled with input format detection. In this case we set the stream format to a default, probably incorrect, value and let the hardware give us the right stream options when it receives the first frame.

Definition at line 68 of file capture_callback.cpp.

◆ VideoInputFrameArrived()

HRESULT DeckLink::CaptureCallback::VideoInputFrameArrived ( IDeckLinkVideoInputFrame *  video_frame,
IDeckLinkAudioInputPacket *   
)
override

This is the function called by the DeckLink driver when a new frame is received.

Parameters
video_frameThe input video frame. It is only valid for the duration of the callback. If we need to keep it around we have to call IDeckLinkVideoFrame::AddRef on it and subsequently IDeckLinkVideoFrame::Release to free it.

The pointer may be null in some situations. This is usually indicative of a problem with the input (i.e. is it even turned on correctly ?)

Returns
The return value is ignored by the caller.
